newsitem.title: USA: FileNet plunges on dismal Q4 forecast.
newsitem.headline: FileNet plunges on dismal Q4 forecast.

text.p: Shares of FileNet Corp took a quick nose-dive Friday after the company said its fourth quarter earnings would be hurt by delayed orders by customers.
FileNet plunged 8-1/2 to 23-1/4 in early-morning trading.

Late Thursday night the company said it expects fourth quarter earnings of $0.20 a share, down from $0.32 a year earlier. The Costa Mesa-based company expects revenues of $73 million, compared to $67.7 million last year.
Fourth quarter revenues and earnings were hurt by a number of customers delaying their orders or reducing the size of their orders late in the quarter, FileNet said.

"However, we did meet our objective of increasing our order backlog," FileNet Chief Executive Ted Smith said. "Product backlog increased significantly and now represents in excess of one-third of our fourth quarter's estimated revenue. This higher backlog should result in more efficient and balanced operations going forward."

For the 1996 full year, FileNet sees revenues of about $269 million, compared to $229 million last year. Net income, before one-time after-tax charges for merger, restructuring and write-off of purchased in-process research and development costs, will be about $0.82 a share, compared to $0.83 last year.
FileNet makes integrated image, data-processing systems using optical disk technology.
